page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES IN CLYDACH
page.content: {Mr & Mrs Sam Williams - 1910 Clydach Vale was an expanding comm- unity with many shops, banks, chemists and a cinema showing silent movies.Few women entered pubs. Social life centered around chapel.Collieries employed 5000 men. School was large. No radio or television {Mr Frank Powell - 1930} Roads were still muddy and cars were few. Collieries were thriving. Miners lived locally and bathed at home. Chapel was still a dominant force. {Mrs Susan Owen - 1950} Declining Collieries caused depopula- tion. Housing conditions were poor with few indoor bathrooms. Great comminity spirit existed. {Children in School - 1985} Numbers in shool now small. Shops are few.Collieries have been grassed over for redevelopment. Chapels are closed
